meanings.definition: To move quickly and suddenly in an upward direction.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel updarted into the tree when it heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: She updarted from her seat when she realized she was late for the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The balloon updarted out of the child's hand, causing a chase around the park.
meanings.sent4: His heart updarted with joy when he saw his long-lost friend at the airport.
meanings.sent5: The rocket updarted into the sky, leaving a trail of smoke behind.

meanings.definition: A sudden or unexpected movement or action.
meanings.sent1: The updart of the rabbit startled the hikers on the trail.
meanings.sent2: Her updart to change the topic caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent3: The updart of the cat knocking over the vase was met with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The updart of the idea sparked a lively discussion among the group.
meanings.sent5: The updart of the wind blew the hat off his head and into the river.
